poem:
### Cut Piece

In a room where scissors whispered,  
fabric fell like leaves,  
a woman stood composed,  
yielding thread by thread.  
An art of shedding skin,  
of choosing when to break,  
while others took from her  
as history took note.  
Yoko, silent, the scalpel's muse,  
a slice into the heart  
of what art might expose.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Yoko by David Sheff review – a queasily one-sided defence In 1966 a woman sat down at the Destruction in Art Symposium at London’s Africa Centre and invited people to cut off her clothes. It was an era when Yves Klein used naked women as paintbrushes and Allen Jones made sculptures of fetishistically dressed women posed as furniture. But Yoko Ono was in control of her own self-sacrifice. It was the third time she’d performed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
